gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10 - Cruise Event Log from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: GT10 - Scientific Sampling Event Log Dataset Description: <p>Scientific Sampling Event Log for KN199-04 (2010 GEOTRACES cruise). Station numbers, Events, Dates/Times, Lat/Lons and Event descriptions are provided for each station.<br /><br /><b>NOTE: No event log maintained for KN199-05</b></p> Acquisition Description: <p>Generated aboard vessel by science party.</p><p><b><i>Event Description Codes:</i></b><br />nd = unknown/not entered<br />GT-C = GEOTRACES carousel<br />30-ODF = 30L Niskin Rosette<br />GeoF = Geos fish<br />RaPUW = Radium UW pump<br />MITv2 = MIT-vane<br />UAFv = UAF-vane<br />KnoR = Knorr rosette<br />MastUp = NASA solar reference mast UP<br />MastDown = NASA solar reference mast DOWN<br />McL-Ros = McLane pump rosette<br />McL-Prof = McLane pump profile<br />Aeros = Aerosol sampler<br />AOP = Apparent Optical Properties cast<br />NASAsurf = NASA surface pump water sample<br />NEMO = NEMO Float Deployment<br />Ra/Th/Pig = Ra/Th/Pigment Niskin Cast</p><p><i><b>Codes for Samples Taken</b></i>:<br />nd = unknown/not recorded<br />diss = dissolved samples<br />diss+part = dissolved and particulate samples<br />unfilt = unfiltered seawater<br />filter = filter for particulates<br />none = none</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0926423 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=0926423
Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0926092 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=0926092

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: event number; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.
PI-supplied Description: location descriptor (typically station id); General Description: Alphanumeric string used as the designator for a sampling site
PI-supplied Description: Start date (GMT); General Description: date sampling begins such as YYYYMMDD
PI-supplied Description: Start time (GMT); General Description: starting time of observation, GMT time, 24 hour clock
PI-supplied Description: End date (GMT); General Description: date sampling ends; as YYYYMMDD
PI-supplied Description: End time (GMT); General Description: ending time of observation, GMT time , 24 hour clock

PI-supplied Description: Latitude (South is negative); General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude (West is negative); General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: Minimum depth; General Description: minimum depth sampled
PI-supplied Description: Maximum depth; General Description: maximum depth sampled

PI-supplied Description: CodeEvent descriptonndunknown/not enteredGT-CGEOTRACES carousel30-ODF30L Niskin RosetteGeoFGeo's fishRaPUWRadium UW pumpMITv2MIT-vaneUAFvUAF-vaneKnoRKnorr rosetteMastUpNASA solar reference mast UPMastDownNASA solar reference mast DOWNMcL-RosMcLane pump rosetteMcL-ProfMcLane pump profileAerosAerosol samplerAOPApparent Optical Properties castNASAsurfNASA surface pump water sampleNEMONEMO Float DeploymentRa/Th/PigRa/Th/Pigment Niskin Cast; General Description: an abbreviation code describing the sampling event type, e.g. CTD, TM, MULVFS, MOCNESS, trap

PI-supplied Description: CodeSamples Takenndunknown/not recordeddissdissolved samplesdiss+partdissolved and particulate samplesunfiltunfiltered seawaterfilterfilter for particulatesnonenone; General Description: text description of sample collected

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES ID Number and Range; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: Event comment; General Description: free text comments, may only have meaning to submitting PI

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>Generated aboard vessel by science party.</p><p><b><i>Event Description Codes:</i></b><br />nd = unknown/not entered<br />GT-C = GEOTRACES carousel<br />30-ODF = 30L Niskin Rosette<br />GeoF = Geos fish<br />RaPUW = Radium UW pump<br />MITv2 = MIT-vane<br />UAFv = UAF-vane<br />KnoR = Knorr rosette<br />MastUp = NASA solar reference mast UP<br />MastDown = NASA solar reference mast DOWN<br />McL-Ros = McLane pump rosette<br />McL-Prof = McLane pump profile<br />Aeros = Aerosol sampler<br />AOP = Apparent Optical Properties cast<br />NASAsurf = NASA surface pump water sample<br />NEMO = NEMO Float Deployment<br />Ra/Th/Pig = Ra/Th/Pigment Niskin Cast</p><p><i><b>Codes for Samples Taken</b></i>:<br />nd = unknown/not recorded<br />diss = dissolved samples<br />diss+part = dissolved and particulate samples<br />unfilt = unfiltered seawater<br />filter = filter for particulates<br />none = none</p>

<p><b>BCO-DMO Processing Notes</b><br />- Generated from original .xlsx file &quot;KN199-4 event log sheet.xlsx&quot; contributed by Bill Jenkins<br />- Lat/Lon converted from degs, decimal minutes to decimal degrees<br />- Lon values signed negative for West<br />- Date reformatted to YYYYMMDD<br />- Time reformatted to HHMM<br />- &quot;nd&quot; (no data) value inserted in blank cells<br />- &quot;n/a&quot; replaced with &quot;nd&quot;<br />- Commas in text fields converted to semicolons<br />- Parameter names modified to conform to BCO-DMO convention&lt;<br />- End dates for events 2003, 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007 changed from 2010/10/16 to 2010/10/15 (25July2011/srg)</p>
